trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Jobscience | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Jobscience | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Jobscience with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Jobscience with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Jobscience
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Jobscience

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <link><linkText>here</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Jobscience.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Jobscience.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Jobscience Single Sign-On enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Jobscience Single Sign-On enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Jobscience will be able to single sign into the application at your Jobscience company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Jobscience will be able to single sign into the application at your Jobscience company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Jobscience
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Jobscience

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Jobscience
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Jobscience

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Jobscience.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Jobscience.

trans-unit.source: To enable the application integration for Jobscience, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To enable the application integration for Jobscience, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type jobscience.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type jobscience.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Jobscience, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Jobscience, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Jobscience</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Jobscience</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Jobscience with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Jobscience with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on for Jobscience requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on for Jobscience requires you to retrieve a thumbprint value from a certificate.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with this procedure, see <link><linkText>How to retrieve a certificate's thumbprint value</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure single sign-on, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Jobscience company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Jobscience company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Setup.
trans-unit.target: Go to Setup.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the left navigation pane, in the Administer section, click Domain Management to expand the related section, and then click My Domain to open the My Domain page.
trans-unit.target: On the left navigation pane, in the Administer section, click Domain Management to expand the related section, and then click My Domain to open the My Domain page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To verify that your domain has been setup correctly, make sure that it is in “Step 4 Deployed to Users” and review your “My Domain Settings”.
trans-unit.target: To verify that your domain has been setup correctly, make sure that it is in “Step 4 Deployed to Users” and review your “My Domain Settings”.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Doman Deployed to User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Doman Deployed to User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log in to your Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log in to your Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: On the Jobscience application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Jobscience application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Jobscience page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Jobscience page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Jobscience Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.my.salesforce.com", and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Jobscience Sign In URL textbox, type your URL using the following pattern "http://company.my.salesforce.com", and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Jobscience page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Jobscience page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Jobscience company site, click Security Controls, and then click Single Sign-On Settings.
trans-unit.target: On the Jobscience company site, click Security Controls, and then click Single Sign-On Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security Controls</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security Controls</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Single Sign-On Settings section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Single Sign-On Settings section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select SAML Enabled.
trans-unit.target: Select SAML Enabled.

trans-unit.source: Click New.
trans-unit.target: Click New.

trans-unit.source: On the SAML Single Sign-On Setting Edit dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the SAML Single Sign-On Setting Edit dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SAML Single Sign-On Setting</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SAML Single Sign-On Setting</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Name textbox, type a name for your configuration.
trans-unit.target: In the Name textbox, type a name for your configuration.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Jobscience dialogue page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Jobscience dialogue page, copy the Issuer URL value, and then paste it into the Issuer textbox

trans-unit.source: In the Entity Id textbox, type https://salesforce-jobscience.com
trans-unit.target: In the Entity Id textbox, type https://salesforce-jobscience.com

trans-unit.source: Click Browse to upload your Azure AD certificate.
trans-unit.target: Click Browse to upload your Azure AD certificate.

trans-unit.source: As SAML Identity Type, select Assertion contains the Federation ID from the User object.
trans-unit.target: As SAML Identity Type, select Assertion contains the Federation ID from the User object.

trans-unit.source: As SAML Identity Location, select Identity is in the NameIdentfier element of the Subject statement.
trans-unit.target: As SAML Identity Location, select Identity is in the NameIdentfier element of the Subject statement.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Jobscience dialogue page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Login URL textbox
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Jobscience dialogue page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Login URL textbox

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Jobscience dialogue page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Logout URL textbox
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Jobscience dialogue page, copy the Remote Logout URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Logout URL textbox

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the left navigation pane, in the Administer section, click Domain Management to expand the related section, and then click My Domain to open the My Domain page.
trans-unit.target: On the left navigation pane, in the Administer section, click Domain Management to expand the related section, and then click My Domain to open the My Domain page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>My Domain</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the My Domain page, in the Login Page Branding section, click Edit.
trans-unit.target: On the My Domain page, in the Login Page Branding section, click Edit.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Login Page Branding</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Login Page Branding</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Login Page Branding page, in the Authentication Service section, the name of your SAML SSO Settings is displayed.
trans-unit.target: On the Login Page Branding page, in the Authentication Service section, the name of your SAML SSO Settings is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Select it, and then click Save.
trans-unit.target: Select it, and then click Save.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Login Page Branding</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Login Page Branding</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To get the SP initiated Single Sign on Login URL click on the Single Sign On settings in the Security Controls menu section.
trans-unit.target: To get the SP initiated Single Sign on Login URL click on the Single Sign On settings in the Security Controls menu section.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Security Controls</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Security Controls</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the SSO profile you have created in the step above.
trans-unit.target: Click the SSO profile you have created in the step above.

trans-unit.source: This page shows the Single Sign on URL for your company (e.g. https://companyname.my.salesforce.com?so=companyid).
trans-unit.target: This page shows the Single Sign on URL for your company (e.g. https://companyname.my.salesforce.com?so=companyid).

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Jobscience, they must be provisioned into Jobscience.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Jobscience, they must be provisioned into Jobscience.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Jobscience, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Jobscience, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure user provisioning, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Jobscience company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Jobscience company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Setup
trans-unit.target: Go to Setup

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Go to Manage Users \> Users.
trans-unit.target: Go to Manage Users \> Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click New User.
trans-unit.target: Click New User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>All Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>All Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Edit User dialog, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Edit User dialog, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>User Edit</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>User Edit</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the first name, last name, alias, email, user name and nickname properties of the Azure AD user you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the first name, last name, alias, email, user name and nickname properties of the Azure AD user you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD account holder will get an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it is activated.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD account holder will get an email that includes a link to confirm the account before it is activated.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Jobscience user account creation tools or APIs provided by Jobscience to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Jobscience user account creation tools or APIs provided by Jobscience to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: To assign users to Jobscience, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To assign users to Jobscience, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Jobscience **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Jobscience **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <link><linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
